metadata.name: Shell Execution via Find - Linux
metadata.comment: Detects the use of the find command to execute a shell. Such behavior may be associated with privilege escalation, unauthorized command execution, or exploitation attempt.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/find')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' . ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-exec')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/bash')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/dash')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/fish')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/sh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/zsh'))))

output.summary: Detects the use of the find command to execute a shell. Such behavior may be associated with privilege escalation, unauthorized command execution, or exploitation attempt.
